Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: DivaJetSetter
Reviews.Content: My husband had a work trip in Indy, and I tagged along. He booked one evening in a regular room and added an extra evening once we got there. The front desk person was very nice and upgraded us to the whirlpool suite right away. That was awesome for a run of the mill business trip, however when I looked at the room number it was still being cleaned (we could see the room from the front desk, which was a little weird to us that she put us there with a cleaning cart clearly there and the door open.) The person cleaning was vacuuming and hurried and finished and got out. I kind of don't think the room was really that thoroughly cleaned. The carpet clearly hadn't been fully vacuumed, the bed was made but not as perfectly as I'm used too (and I stay pretty middle range hotels), and the comforter on top had something on it. Also when you look out the window there was a bunch of garbage scattered all over. We discarded the comforter and checked the other blankets which were in fact clean. There was a paper that said they had 100 channels with Direct TV, but initially we only got several very fuzzy channels. I played with the cord a little and it cleared everything up, but a far cry from 100 channels. The tv was nice though. The bed was very comfortable. I had been having some neck issues and slept great with the bed and pillows provided. Breakfast was decent enough (probably a step above the cold continental offerings), oatmeal, little muffins, cereal, bagels, bread, a waffle maker, some sausage patties, and pre-made egg patties. Since I was at the hotel while my husband worked, I considered swimming. However the pool didn't really look clean when we looked in on our way up to the room, so I decided to forgo that idea. The hot tub was great when we decided to give it a try. No complaints there at all. (We did use the one in our room not the whirlpool that is in the same area as the pool though) It was about 20 minutes or so from downtown and the same distance opposite direction from a bigger selection of restaurants which worked out fine for us. There isn't really much besides fast food nearby. The hotel could really use some updating, which it seems is in the future. I'd consider coming back with a little overhaul and better cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Small Beds for a spacious room”
Reviews.Author: cberry135
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the President's day weekend in a double bed "suite", which is really nothing more than a large room. Not even a room divider. It came with a mini fridge and microwave. It had a small couch and two double beds. New 32" flat panel HDTV, but only a very limited selection of HD channels. The room was certainly large enough to accommodate two queen beds, but they only put in doubles. It does have an indoor pool, hot tub and work out room which are adequate, but nothing spectacular. The self serve free breakfast was okay and included waffle maker, sausage patties, hot eggs, cereal, breads, but the coffee was awful. Other than a business office park not much else around in the immediate area besides a gas station and fast food joints.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Eve crashpad”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: Not many guests. Very quiet, Decent bed. Both down and down alternative pillows were given per bed, Nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a big room....”
Reviews.Author: thomasannen
Reviews.Content: Room was bigger than average. King room with pillow top and down pillows. What was interesting was the front room with full size sleeper with cocktail table. Between they area and the bed was an arch. It added a nice touch. One complaint- TV is severely outdated.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for the price..”
Reviews.Author: teamster175
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 200pm plenty of parking for a semi...this is an older facility from the outside it average for an older motel but inside is great..well kept...very clean...great beds...nice and quiet great for a day sleeper...and the people were also great...I cant remember the exact price but it was very reasonable ....when around northern Indy I will always stay here...cant beat it!..

Reviews.Title: “Seemed like a nice place, but nothing in our room worked.”
Reviews.Author: AWittyMoniker
Reviews.Content: This Clarion Hotel is in a decent area and seems to be well kept.... until we attempted to use anything in our room. First, the positives: The hotel offers a nice lobby, breakfast area, and pool. The rooms are clean and comfortable as you would expect for a hotel in this class. However.... upon settling into our room, it didn't take long to realize that maintenance needs to be more diligent. First thing I always do upon entering a hotel room is to adjust the temperature. After fiddling with the controls I finally coaxed the A/C compressor into running.... for 30 seconds. The room remained stuffy and a bit warm throughout the night. Also, the in-room phone was unusable. Not sure what the issue was, but it sounded like the dial tone was having a fight with a bobcat. Finally, I had chosen a room with a whirlpool tub. One problem.... there was no way to plug the tub. There was some odd thing in the plug hole, but there was no way to make it stop the water from draining. I'm fairly mechanically inclined, yet I was baffled. Obviously, a whirlpool tub is useless without the ability to hold water. For fairness, I need to mention that due to the fact that my sleepy family of 5 arrived at the hotel late, these issues were not mentioned to the staff until morning, so they had no opportunity to rectify them. The staff was very apologetic and professional in the morning. I would have been more upset had this not been a free stay through then Choice Hotels rewards program. Nevertheless, having this many things broken in one room should never happen at a hotel in this class.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Getway”
Reviews.Author: KayseN
Reviews.Content: What a great getaway with friends to ring in the New Year. This Clarion Inn & Suites is in a great location close to area Restaurants and Shopping Our check in was quick and easy. The Staff was very helpful suggesting a very good restaurants even providing directions. We chose Rick's Boatyard Cafe. Everything was wonderful from the Seafood, pastas and salads. Dining by the firplace to watching the sunset made our experience even better. Ricks is a don't miss on your trip to Indy. Also a local favorite is Trader Joes an upscale friendly, wacky grocery that sales great wine and speciality foods. Ah we made 2 trips Other things to do was a trip to the Fountain Square area about 30 min. from the Hotel for dinner at the Smokehouse on shelby. The food was very good but allow time if you have reservations for Duck Pin Bowling which is in the same building. This is a don't miss. even people that hate bowling thought this was GREAT! The only disappointment with this Clarion was the free Breakfast We observed unused milk being poured back in the carton for the next day UCK! Try McDonalds across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: lynnie_sue203
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for the night. We were traveling through and it fit our needs perfectly. We also got an extra sitting area (not sure if that was an upgrade or all rooms have it) but it was nice to have the extra space that we didn't get in other hotels during our cross-country traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls - you can hear everything”
Reviews.Author: SammyBr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights on a business trip. Decent amenities for the price. The walls and ceilings are very thin. You can hear everything going on in the rooms beside and above your room. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: dbwooden
Reviews.Content: This property was very nice as was the room and the restaurant. I stayed here one night on business and found the room to be extremely clean, quiet and comfy. The included breakfast buffet was excellent and the proximity to everything was perfect. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: TiffSil
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms through Priceline, and we were very pleased with what we got for the rate! Rooms have 2 bed queen pillowtop beds with down comforters and duvets, nice pillows. There is also a couch and microwave and fridge in every room. Rooms were clean, staff was very friendly, the breakfast was great (wish it was open a little later, ends at 9), pool and hot tub were wonderful! The pool does feel cool, but you really do get used to it and its fine. We were on the first floor and could sometimes hear the people above us, but it wasn't enough to be a problem. Overall it was a great value and a great place to stay! We would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Cappy536
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our toddler for a weekend away in Indy from Chicago. Clarion was the perfect location for us to meet up with old friends, visit Butler University, and go to the Children's Museum. We arrived after 11:00 pm on a Friday and were given excellent service and a room right around the corner from the front desk. We loved the king bed suite which had a mini-fridge and microwave for toddler snacks. Our toddler loved the indoor pool (great that is open from 6:00 AM - 10:00 PM). Breakfast was typical, but staff was waiting around to refill any thing and help throw away our trash. We even asked the front desk for directions to the Museum and he immediately printed out exact directions for us. We will defintely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Cold Pool”
Reviews.Author: Witman
Reviews.Content: The Good - Nice location just off the interstate and near a large state park. The intersection is undergoing major construction but we didn't have any trouble given we were there on a weekend. The room is large with a very comfortable king-size bed. I believe they only have king size beds at this smallish hotel. Continental breakfast was provided and there were a few warm items (egg & sausage patties) along with the typical cereal and bagels---(they did run out of pastries however). The bad - our kids really wanted to swim but the "heated" pool was too cold for all but the most determined children. I don't think the water was heated. I suspect that the clerks heat the pool room to 85 degrees and then simply assume that the water would also reach that temperature. Of course, it doesn't work that way and the result was a cold pool. Because of the cold pool and the inability/unwillingness of the desk people to make any changes to the pool temperature we would not choose this hotel again. If you don't want to use the pool then this hotel is great.

HotelInfo.Name: Clarion Inn & Suites Northwest
HotelInfo.Address: 7001 Corporate Dr., Indianapolis, IN 46278-1938
